subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Text Conversion
msgSnippet: You should actually automate this convertor program in such a way, that it queries you on a word that can have multiple pronunciations, such as read : I read
messageBody:
You should actually automate this convertor program in such a way, that it queries you on a word
that can have multiple pronunciations, such as 'read':

I read a book
I have read a book

I think this is one of the major problems with automated convertion.

Another technique would be to have the converter ignore those words (they remain in roman writing) so the
proofreader can easily locate them and change them to the proper pronunciation by hand. This is perhaps easier
to program.

Ewout


21-7-03 3:45:54, Chuck Peck <chuck091956@...> wrote:

>

> Subject:[Read_Alphabet] Text Conversion
>
>
>
> Hello All,
>
> I'm in the process of building a Perl Script to convert Orthodox character
> text files into QuickScript ones. It will use the database that generated
> the dictionary that is in the Files section. I'm currently working on the
> grammar/phonics rules that will try to convert works not in the database
> into their phonic equivalent. I think I have someone who will convert the
> formatted MS Word docs into Adobe PDF for me.
>
> Once its done... hopefully sometime next month, I'm going to start
> converting some of the Gutenberg classic text pieces into QS. If anyone has
> any recommendations of writings they'd like to see in QS please let me know.
>
> I'll update the group as I get closer to completing it.
>
>
> Chuck
